text: The 1995 UCI Mountain Bike World Championships were held in Kirchzarten, Germany from 18 to 19 September 1995. These were the sixth annual UCI world championships in mountain biking and the first to be held in Germany. Alison Sydor of Canada successfully defended her world title in the women's cross country. The men's cross country was won by Bart Brentjens of the Netherlands, who would win the first Olympic gold medal in men's cross country the following year at the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta. Nicolas Vouilloz of France won the men's downhill in his first year in the elite category, after having won the junior men's downhill world title the three previous years. Leigh Donovan of the United States won the women's downhill. ==Medal summary== ===Men's events=== {| |- |Cross-country | | | |- |Downhill | | | |- |Junior downhill | | | |} ===Women's events=== {| |- |Cross-country | | | |- |Downhill | | | |- |Junior downhill | | | |} ===Medal table=== ==References== ==External links== Category:UCI Mountain Bike World Championships 1995 UCI Mountain Bike World Championships UCI Mountain Bike World Championships
title: 1995 UCI Mountain Bike World Championships
